revised_title: The Role of Corpora Lutea and Foetal Development in Mammary Gland Progression in Rabbits
tldr: The author investigates the causes behind the developmental progress of the mammary glands in rabbits during the latter part of pregnancy. They find that the corpus luteum maintains its size throughout pregnancy and that the growth changes in the mammary gland are correlated with the further development of corpora lutea. The study also suggests that the myometrial gland, previously thought to play a significant role, does not have a significant function in this process.
